channel.title: 2048 for Android
channel.description:
I went ahead and ported the popular craze of 2048 to android for everyones enjoyment
[url=https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=net.com.codeusasoft.game2048]https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=net.com.codeusasoft.game2048[/url]
I spent hours on this, best I got was 3 512's and I couldn't connect them..
Recent Changes: Fixed bug draining battery life Added restart button Improved animation quality on older devices Added support for all versions of android Added twitter social sharing Fixed point addition lag Added session saving (You can close the app and start where you left off) Added best score saving Fixed missing squares on restart

item.title: 2048 for Android
item.dc:creator: @justaguy justaguy
item.description:
@justaguy wrote:

RSCShadow:

The last I remember, Android had some subpar webkit-based browser along w/ Chrome & Firefox available.

Their default browser is horrible (especially in terms of providing latest features such as WebWorkers) and unfortunately that is what web application frameworks depend on for WebView (the reason web app frameworks can be made to run on any device).

Read full topic

item.title: 2048 for Android
item.dc:creator: @RSCShadow RSCShadow
item.description:
@RSCShadow wrote:

The last I remember, Android had some subpar webkit-based browser along w/ Chrome & Firefox available.

item.title: 2048 for Android
item.dc:creator: @Codeusa11 Codeusa11
item.description:
@Codeusa11 wrote:

[quote=“eyeownyew, post:14, topic:541485”][quote author=Codeusa11 link=topic=660355.msg4415961#msg4415961 date=1395942706]

Well what’s ironic is HTML5 is likely to be the end of native code on mobile devices, so you have that to look forward to!

Debatable. I’d much rather have them co-exist (and this means support for webkit applications should be done properly) because not every developer is proficient in web technologies.

+1

Plus some things are just easier to do relying solely on the SDK for Android rather than building it totally as a web app first.
[/quote]
But then it’s not portable through every device with HTML5 support, only Androids. Sure, it might be useful sometimes, but HTML5 is a much better alternative if you are looking to have the same functionality on multiple devices (like 2048 did).[/quote]
but it won’t always function correctly because then you rely on the phones Webview, which somehow in androids case get worst each version.

Read full topic

Debatable. I’d much rather have them co-exist (and this means support for webkit applications should be done properly) because not every developer is proficient in web technologies.

Plus some things are just easier to do relying solely on the SDK for Android rather than building it totally as a web app first.[/quote]

item.title: 2048 for Android
item.dc:creator: @Codeusa11 Codeusa11
item.description:
@Codeusa11 wrote:

eyeownyew:

Is HTML5 not considered native? It’s just as native as any other language could possibly be

No? The native language of all android applications is Java, I wanted to write it using Androids systems rather than relying on its terrible web kit.

Read full topic

item.title: 2048 for Android
item.dc:creator: @eyeownyew Eyeownyew
item.description:

item.title: 2048 for Android
item.dc:creator: @Codeusa11 Codeusa11
item.description:
@Codeusa11 wrote:

[quote=“eyeownyew, post:6, topic:541485”][quote author=vortex link=topic=660355.msg4415659#msg4415659 date=1395785809]
The original game works on touch devices though
[/quote]
yeaaah… It’s made in HTML5, why are you doing this?[/quote]

Because I wanted a native port?

Read full topic

item.title: 2048 for Android
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“eyeownyew, post:6, topic:541485”][quote author=vortex link=topic=660355.msg4415659#msg4415659 date=1395785809]
The original game works on touch devices though
[/quote]
yeaaah… It’s made in HTML5, why are you doing this?[/quote]
Why not? Everyone is. I’ve seen 2 or 3 2048’s made in java on these forums. I’ve seen it done in Flash (on kongregate) and some other formats. It’s just like the flappy bird craze, but this game is easier to reproduce.

Also, the code for 2048 is open source on the website… https://github.com/gabrielecirulli/2048

Read full topic

item.title: 2048 for Android
item.dc:creator: @Codeusa11 Codeusa11
item.description:
@Codeusa11 wrote:

I went ahead and ported the popular craze of 2048 to android for everyones enjoyment

https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=net.com.codeusasoft.game2048

I spent hours on this, best I got was 3 512’s and I couldn’t connect them…

Recent Changes:
Fixed bug draining battery life
Added restart button
Improved animation quality on older devices
Added support for all versions of android
Added twitter social sharing
Fixed point addition lag
Added session saving (You can close the app and start where you left off)
Added best score saving
Fixed missing squares on restart
